show_title: GM Farcaster ep257 Wednesday June 11, 2025 presented by Octant
text:
gm gm ‚ù§Ô∏è

We're finally ready to unveil Epoch 8.

ü•Åü•Åü•Å This epoch is an Ethereum-core alignment epoch. It's a special one because it's a major step in our broader roadmap to contribute to Ethereum's growth.

Like Epoch 7, there's no snapshot. Our internal reviewers will select projects based on impact and relevance.

Allocation window remains the same. ETH rewards are time-weighted and allocating to projects get you matched

üóìApplication Deadline: 3 June, 2025 @ 11:59 pm PST

üõ† Who should apply?
Builders advancing Ethereum in 4 core areas:

1) Direct protocol improvements (consensus, execution, data availability, core networking)

2) Shared infrastructure (clients, testnets & tooling, p2p networking stacks, security & formal-verification frameworks, transparency)

3) Open dashboards, datasets, or studies (roll-ups, bridges, MEVs -  resulting insights must strengthen Ethereum)

4) Protocol-level research + specification work (advancing Ethereum's roadmap)

App link + eligibility criteria üëá

text:
** Rewards Leaderboard Results **

++ Inaugural Top 3 $600 Tier ++

* Fittingly @keccers.eth is the first #1 & her first win; she has finished #11 or #12 more than we'd like to count. All she had to do was take a trip to Iceland to reach #1!

* @elvi first week pays off big at #2, arriving as a content creator jumping in w/ both feet

* What would the inaugural top 3 be without @bertwurst.eth ? üêæ (Heads up, there will be less Bert this coming week, so a spot will open)

* @pugson returns to top 5 & @matthewb gets closer to buying 'dan the dishwasher' iykyk--each collecting $350 along with the other top 10s

show_title: GM Farcaster ep257 Wednesday June 11, 2025 presented by Octant
text:
Farcaster maintaining a steadfast commitment to free speech is vital to its continued growth. 

There's a real degree of civility here. The easy explanation for that is that the community is still small, so people are polite in the same way Iceland is civil or a countryclub is a civil. But I suspect there's another dimension to it: there's money on the line here, and acting rude is a bad way to get people to want to give you any. 

Hopefully that insulates this place against needing to crack down on the kind of bigotry or harmful posting you see on other platforms. But either way, let Substack be the model for /farcaster. Better to allow some vile posting and let the social marketplace sort it out than step into the quagmire of censorship according to shifting social norms.

show_title: GM Farcaster ep257 Wednesday June 11, 2025 presented by Octant
text: #1 reason to use Farcaster

show_title: GM Farcaster ep257 Wednesday June 11, 2025 presented by Octant
text: The reason I draw parallels to the hobby computer industry is because the same kind of niche user base exists: people who are willing to put up with super leaky abstractions, exposed wires and rough edges, to make a spreadsheet or draw a circle. Much like Apple's vision of the "bicycle for the mind" of personal computing, crypto needs its own story to tell. And money isn't compelling enough, that's just an application. If you were to distill the unique attributes of crypto, and then amplify that sole distillation into a single message, as what is the ultimate purpose of crypto? You would say that it gives you autonomy, freedom to move, to interact across borders, with a unified store of trust. If personal computers took off because they were the "bicycle for the mind", crypto will take off as the "passport for the mind"
